Tera Water greatly increases Hydro Steam's damage while removing Walking Wake's weaknesses to Dragon- and Fairy-type moves.
  • The EVs listed boost Walking Wake's Speed in sun. If a Special Attack boost is desired, move 8 EVs from Special Defense into Special Attack.

Trick Room.description:
• Sinistcha faces competition from Grass-type redirectors like Ogerpon-W, Ogerpon-H and Amoongus. However, Sinistcha manages to gain a niche in bulky teams due to Hospitality healing either an ally just enough to survive an extra hit or a Pokemon that your opponent doesn't have the resources to deal with anymore like setup Raging Bolt and Iron Hands.

  • Rage Powder allows Sinistcha to redirect attacks away from its partner, giving allies a safe opportunity to set up or attack without worrying about being targeted.

  • Sitrus Berry recovery increases the chance of Sinistcha taking two attacks in the same turn, allowing it to set Trick Room or, the following turn, use Rage Powder or switch out to heal again with Hospitality on a later turn.

  • Matcha Gotcha hits most of the metagame for neutral damage and threatens Diancie and both Ursaluna formes for super effective damage. The recovery provided by Matcha Gotcha allows Sinistcha to support its allies longer and survive both neutral and super effective attacks.

  • Trick Room gives Sinistcha valuable speed control, allowing it to reverse the flow of the battle against Tailwind teams or to nullify an opposing Trick Room.

  • Sinistcha's best partners are setup sweepers like Swords Dance Iron Hands, Calm Mind Raging Bolt, and Nasty Plot Galarian Moltres, all of which make good use of the healing and redirection it provides. Sinistcha also fits well on snow teams with Alolan Ninetales and Kyurem, as the added bulk given by Aurora Veil allows it to switch in multiple times.

  • Shadow Ball 2HKOes Gholdengo, a Pokemon that otherwise sets up easily in front of Sinistcha. Life Dew can situationally heal bulky Pokemon like Ting Lu and Raging Bolt, while Protect positions around threatening attacks and blocks Tornadus’s Taunt.

  • The given EV spread maximizes Sinistcha's bulk, allowing it to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and Blizzard from maximum Special Attack Modest Kyurem while still almost threatening 2HKOs on Diancie and both Ursaluna formes.

  • Tera Water makes the above Ice-type attacks a 3HKO and removes Sinistcha's Fire weakness, letting it handle Fire-types like Incineroar easier. Tera Water also helps against Gholdengo by removing the Ghost weakness and allowing Sinistcha to resist Make It Rain.

Assault Vest.description: Okidogi's Speed investment lets it outspeed Dragapult and Adamant Choice Scarf Landorus-T in Tailwind.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Ivy Cudgel is a strong STAB option that hits common threats like Landorus, Incineroar, and Diancie super effectively and threatens an OHKO on Flutter Mane while also dealing solid damage to neutral targets.
  • Ogerpon-W has quite a few options for its Grass-type STAB attack to hit Water-resistant foes like Palafin, Volcanion, and opposing Ogerpon-W. Horn Leech has respectable power in addition to giving Ogerpon-W a way to sustain itself, which can be helpful considering how crucial its health is. Power Whip is a stronger option, allowing Ogerpon-W to hit some targets harder than it would with Ivy Cudgel such as Tyranitar and Ursaluna.
  • Follow Me leverages Ogerpon-W's good typing to support its team and shield its teammates from threatening attacks and status moves, with Water Absorb allowing it to heal from Water-type attacks such as Palafin's Jet Punch and Volcanion's Steam Eruption. Encore punishes Fake Out, Protect, and speed control moves, forcing the Encore target to switch out or repeatedly use a detrimental move, generating momentum for Ogerpon-W's team.
  • Ogerpon-W usually uses Spiky Shield, but on faster-paced teams, it might opt to drop this for Encore due to the utility of Follow Me being desired in addition to Encore's potential to swing the momentum of a game.
  • In addition to the usual benefits, Ogerpon-W gains +1 Special Defense upon Terastallizing, considerably improving its matchups against Flutter Mane and Deoxys-A.
  • The given EV spread lets Ogerpon-W outspeed Landorus and survive a Tera Stellar Chien-Pao Icicle Crash, with the rest of the EVs going into Attack to allow Power Whip to OHKO maximum HP Flutter Mane. Alternatively, an EV spread of 252 HP / 28 Atk / 84 Def / 72 SpD / 72 Spe with an Adamant nature can be used to survive a Choice Band Tera Normal Extreme Speed from Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active or a Choice Specs Tera Fairy Moonblast from maximum Special Attack Flutter Mane while still outspeeding Smeargle and Modest Glimmora.
  • Tornadus makes a great partner for Ogerpon-W, as it provides Prankster Tailwind support and threatens Grass-types Ogerpon-W can't touch such as Rillaboom and opposing Ogerpon-W with Bleakwind Storm, and it can even strengthen Ivy Cudgel with Rain Dance. Flutter Mane threatens out Dragon-types like Baxcalibur and Raging Bolt that resist Ogerpon-W's STAB combination, and it appreciates the potential Follow Me support Ogerpon-W provides to draw strong priority attacks like Kingambit's Sucker Punch and Rillaboom's Grassy Glide away from it. Setup Pokemon such as Swords Dance Kingambit appreciate Ogerpon-W providing both Follow Me and Encore support to generate setup opportunities for them by either redirecting attacks or shutting down an opposing Pokemon.

Cudgel Bonk.description:
• Ogerpon-H uses Wood Hammer to deal huge damage, allowing it to OHKO Diancie and both Ursaluna formes. Horn Leech can be used instead to increase its longevity at the cost of dealing a lot less damage.
  • Ogerpon-H provides redirection, allowing its allies to set up or position safely. Ogerpon-H is particularly good at redirecting Spore from Amoonguss due to its immunity.
  • Focus Energy can be run over Follow Me to increase Ogerpon-H's offensive prowess. This allows Ivy Cudgel to always be a critical hit, letting Ogerpon-H ignore Attack drops from Incineroar's Intimidate and damage reduction from Alolan Ninetales's Aurora Veil.
  • When Ogerpon-H Terastallizes, Embody Aspect enables it to easily threaten Kyurem in snow through Aurora Veil with Ivy Cudgel, and it loses its weakness to Sludge Bomb from Landorus and Bleakwind Storm from Tornadus. Ogerpon-H is capable of OHKOing Landorus and 2HKOing Iron Hands and Cresselia with Ivy Cudgel thanks to Terastallization.
  • Ogerpon-H is primarily used as an offensive threat, capable of OHKOing prominent offensive and support Pokemon, such as Gholdengo, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Sinistcha.
  • Ogerpon-H synergizes well with Chien-Pao, since it can easily threaten Landorus and Tornadus, which Ogerpon-H is offensively threatened by due to their strong STAB move. Ogerpon-H threatens Steel-types Chien-Pao struggles against such as Gholdengo and Kingambit.
  • Ground-types such as Landorus and Ursaluna-B greatly appreciate Ogerpon-H's ability to threaten Rillaboom, which threatens both with its potent Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide. Meanwhile, both can easily dispatch Raging Bolt, which Ogerpon-H struggles against.
  • Dragon-type partners, such as Raging Bolt and Regidrago, appreciate Ogerpon-H KOing threats like Chien-Pao and Alolan Ninetales as well as common redirectors like Amoonguss and Sinistcha. Ogerpon-H's redirection utility additionally allows Raging Bolt to easily set up with Calm Mind. In return, Raging Bolt can easily dispatch Ogerpon-W, opposing Raging Bolt, and Roaring Moon, which threaten Ogerpon-H and are tricky for it to defeat. Meanwhile, Regidrago's Dragon Energy can remove Dragon-types that Ogerpon-H struggles to damage.
  • Ogerpon-H supports Steel-types like Gholdengo and Kingambit exceptionally well. Ogerpon-H threatens opposing Steel-types its teammates struggle to damage as well as Ground-types that threaten them like the Ursaluna formes. In return, Gholdengo provides a strong special offensive presence to complement Ogerpon-H's physical offense, and Kingambit dissuades Intimidate cycling from Incineroar thanks to Defiant.
  • Ogerpon-H works very well on a core of Gholdengo, Tornadus,and Regidrago, taking advantage of their offensive coverage and Tailwind support as well as providing its own offensive coverage as well as redirection.

Assault Vest.description: • This EV spread survives Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien Pao, OHKOes Max HP Tornadus with Thunderbolt, and outspeeds uninvested Rillaboom and Chien-Pao in Tailwind.

Calm Mind.description: • This EV Spread survives a Life Orb Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao and +2 Kowtow Cleave from Kingambit.

Fast Calm Mind Sweeper.description:
• Iron Crown is one of the best sweepers of the tier that, thanks to Expanding Force, hits really hard even without boosts! With Booster Energy, Iron Crown outspeeds almost everything in the metagame, and while in Psychic Terrain, it can gain a significant advantage early-game or close games easily after Dark- and Steel-types in its path have been removed.

  • Tachyon Cutter hits harder than Expanding Force when Psychic Terrain isn't up and helps against snow teams, OHKOing Alolan Ninetales before it can set up Aurora Veil. Notably, its two-hit nature allows Iron Crown to remove Focus Sash Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Glimmora with one move.

  • Calm Mind makes Iron Crown hard to remove with special attackers, especially if it Terastallized, and also helps to KO bulkier Pokemon like Terastallized Assault Vest Iron Hands, Assault Vest Rillaboom, and Gholdengo.

  • The EV spread is made to get the boost in Speed with Quark Drive while getting the maximum Special Attack possible, and the bulk investment is used to take a Flare Blitz from Incineroar.

  • Iron Crown pairs perfectly with Indeedee-F by setting up Psychic Terrain, helping it set up Calm Mind with Follow Me, and enabling it with Helping Hand to pick up KOs on foes like Terastallized Ogerpon-W after a boost. Iron Crown appreciates Follow Me for setup, and for this reason, it's usually paired with Ogerpon-W or Ogerpon-H. Ogerpon-W helps in dealing with Landorus and Fire-types like Incineroar and Chi-Yu, which can threaten Iron Crown, while Ogerpon-H can remove Steel-types like Gholdengo and Kingambit, which would otherwise prevent a sweep. Both Ogerpon formes can also threaten Ting-Lu, a foe that's otherwise hard to remove.

  • Landorus is another Pokemon that helps to remove Steel- and Fire-types. Tornadus is great too, since it threatens Rillaboom with Bleakwind Storm and makes sure that Iron Crown is always the fastest Pokemon by matching the Tailwind from opposing Tornadus and Roaring Moon.

  • Tera Psychic increases Expanding Force's damage output further, helping to get KOs and putting a lot of pressure on the opponent, especially after a Calm Mind. It also allows Iron Crown to take neutral damage from Landorus's Earth Power, Incineroar's Flare Blitz, and Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel. Tera Dragon allows Iron Crown to wall both Ogerpon-W and Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and take neutral damage from Gholdengo's Shadow Ball and Dark-type moves from Kingambit and Chien-Pao. The added resistances are especially useful in the Rillaboom matchup, since the STAB boost from Tera Psychic isn't as relevant without Psychic Terrain.
